image.altText: The sun rises above a highway. The sky is coloured red and yellow.

props.synopsis: The first heatwave of the summer will reach its peak across New South Wales today, with temperatures above 40 degrees Celsius likely to span from Western Australia's north-west all the way to Parramatta.

title.children: Large parts of the country to pass 40C as heatwave crosses Australia

image.altText: Woman speaking under a tree

props.synopsis: How does a treasurer tell households the government will no longer continue a $300 energy rebate when it's happy to blow $100,000 on three flights?

title.children: Expensive flights don't pass the pub test in the age of belt-tightening

image.altText: A man standing next to a pile of supplies looks out the window of a helicopter over a lush green landscape.l

props.synopsis: Landslides across Sumatra in Indonesia have cut off roads and destroyed homes, creating several pockets of isolated villages where a helicopter is the only way in.

title.children: Indonesia's Sumatra devastated by cyclones and monsoon rains

image.altText: A soldier waves a Ukrainian flag with his right hand as he holds a rifle in his left hand while standing atop a concrete block.

props.synopsis: When it comes to weaponry, Russia has strength in manpower despite Ukraine's early technological edge while Europe's arms production efforts are running into infrastructure hurdles.

title.children: Europe faces obstacles in preparing for Russian aggression

image.altText: Donald Trump speaks to reporters outside the White House

props.synopsis: The US president has spent much of his first year back in office changing the historic building he fought to reclaim in a bid to cement his legacy.

title.children: Trump is remaking the White House in his own image before it is too late

image.altText: Ben Stokes holds his hands on his head as Steve Smith and Cameron Green run past him

props.synopsis: Australia took control of the second Ashes Test at the Gabba on a day that carried plenty of the hallmarks of failed English tours of yesteryear.

title.children: Australia delights in a familiar tale of English woe at the Gabba

image.altText: Donald Trump holds a microphone and speaks next to the World Cup trophy.

props.synopsis: Australia is set to face the US, Paraguay and a European play-off winner in the initial group stage of next year's FIFA World Cup.

title.children: Socceroos to face host nation US in Men's World Cup

image.altText: The Netflix logo is shown on one of their buildings in the Hollywood neighborhood of Los Angeles

props.synopsis: The merger will see beloved shows and movies such as The Big Bang Theory, Game of Thrones and The Wizard of Oz join Netflix’s portfolio.

title.children: Netflix to acquire Warner Bros's studio and streaming service for $108bn

image.altText: A building damaged from warfare.

props.synopsis: Lebanon's government says it is trying to disarm militant group Hezbollah, but there are fears of sparking an internal conflict.

title.children: Hezbollah refuses to disarm while Israel continues bombing Lebanon

image.altText: Charlotte Walker

props.synopsis: As the social media ban for teens looms, the parliament's most recent senator reveals she knows firsthand the dangers that can confront young people online.

title.children: Australia's youngest senator was catfished on social media as a teen

image.altText: Three young girls, with the middle one carrying a toddler.

props.synopsis: The stark beauty of Australia's protected APY Lands is alive with ancient songlines and culture. But Elders see a need for change to secure the future of today's children.

title.children: Rare look at family, country and culture on the remote APY Lands

image.altText: A close up historic shot of a man wearing aviator sunglasses.

props.synopsis: Convicted killer Bevan Spencer von Einem — who police have linked to "The Family" — has died while serving a life sentence for the sexually motivated abduction and murder of Richard Kelvin in 1983.

title.children: Breaking: Notorious murderer Bevan von Einem dies while serving life sentence

image.altText: Melbourne State Theatre

props.synopsis: No sensible organisation can now afford to turn down money or its requirements. So, cash-strapped institutions find themselves between a rock and a hard place with a big name painted on it.

title.children: Why all of Melbourne's major arts institutions have the same name

image.altText: Two men shake hands in front of a fireplace with decorative flowers on the mantle

props.synopsis: The offer is made at a summit in New Delhi, where new deals on energy, agriculture and labour have also been announced.

title.children: Vladimir Putin offers India 'uninterrupted' fuel supplies

image.altText: Orange bottle of sunscreen, a hat, sunglasses, starfish and shell on sand.

props.synopsis: With sunscreen testing in the spotlight this year, how do laboratories test how effectively products protect our skin from the Sun's rays?

title.children: How your sunscreen gets its SPF rating

image.altText: A splitscreen graphic showing 50 in orange against a blue background beside another 50 in blue against an orange background

props.synopsis: Every question has only two options: one is right and the other is wrong. You have an even chance of guessing correctly each time.

title.children: 50/50 quiz: This week we're testing your knowledge on Madonna, the Matrix and Pac-Man

image.altText: Two Moodjar trees sitting under a twilight night sky.

props.synopsis: As the summer heat settles in, flora and fauna associated with Christmas in Australia can be spotted throughout the country.

title.children: World's largest mistletoe among flora blooming for Australian Christmas

image.altText: Kaitlyn Dever recreates Belle Gibson's infamous 60 Minutes interview, with a ponytail and pink jumper.

props.synopsis: Apple Cider Vinegar, a partly fictionalised retelling of accused wellness scammer Belle Gibson's public fall from grace, leads this year's AACTA nominations.

title.children: Belle Gibson drama tops 2026 AACTA nominations

image.altText: Bags of intravenous fluids hooked up to tubes in a hospital room

props.synopsis: A Queensland hospital has increased staffing and revamped its radiology protocols and systems following an 87-year-old's death from organ failure after routine surgery.

title.children: Death prompts major hospital protocol overhaul as inquest scrutinises 'chaotic day'

image.altText: Elon Musk holding his hands up to his mouth.

props.synopsis: European Union regulators say the breaches of the bloc's digital regulations could leave users exposed to scams and manipulation.

title.children: EU hits Musk's X with $210 million fine for breaching bloc's social media law

image.altText: Two people sitting with their arms around a third, all smiling at the camera

props.synopsis: Rowan Tong-Law, 18, was diagnosed with acute myeloid leukaemia last year and has been searching for a full stem cell donor match.

title.children: Thousands join stem cell donor roll but still no match for Rowan

image.altText: An aerial photo of Hobart's CBD and Macquarie Point.

props.synopsis: That and other questions answered now that the $1.13 billion stadium project has passed Tasmania's parliament.

title.children: When will construction begin on the Hobart stadium?

image.altText: Aunty and niece sit in the garden and smile at the camera.

props.synopsis: One Deaf woman living with dementia has been without basic care services for two years. Advocates warn her story represents a much larger problem.

title.children: Deaf residents in aged care left without basic support services

image.altText: The outside of the County Court of Victoria building.

props.synopsis: A County Court jury finds a man guilty of two charges of raping a woman in his home after a night of drinking with friends.

title.children: Man from high-profile Victorian family found guilty of rape

image.altText: A groundsman crouches down to touch the pitch on a cricket ground, as he holds a tool used to flatten pitches.

props.synopsis: The Adelaide-Hobart WBBL match has to be abandoned after a ball goes under the roller during the innings break, creating a hole in the pitch.

title.children: Hole in Adelaide pitch complicates WBBL finals puzzle

image.altText: A woman in a singlet leans against a wooden bench, with plumbing equipment on bench

props.synopsis: After decades of sewage back flow problems, Townsville City Council is funding a fix that could keep raw human waste out of homes and backyards.

title.children: Sewage spray in Queensland homes to be fixed but not before next wet season

image.altText: a historic aerial photo of three north melbourne public housing towers in black and white

props.synopsis: A 1960s North Melbourne public housing tower slated for imminent demolition has been nominated for protection under state heritage laws, following a successful appeal by a tenants group.

title.children: Heritage bid to save public housing tower slated for demolition

image.altText: A wine industry expert stands amid vines.

props.synopsis: Among the main factors contributing to women leaving Australia's wine industry were sexism, discrimination, and a lack of flexibility, a nationwide study has found.

title.children: Sexism, harassment and inflexibility drive women out of winemaking

image.altText: An aerial view of a pool, shade sails and buildings among trees, with Uluru in the background.

props.synopsis: A deal for the sale of operations at Ayers Rock Resort, near Uluru, and the Mossman Gorge Cultural Centre, in Far North Queensland, is one step closer after the Indigenous Land and Sea Corporation reached an agreement with Journey Beyond, an Australian-based "experiential tourism" company owned by an American private equity firm.

title.children: Ayers Rock Resort operation being sold to US company

image.altText: The pendant on some paper towels with someone wearing a blue latex glove holding onto it.

props.synopsis: Police officers were with the suspect around the clock until the stolen pendant was recovered.

title.children: NZ police recover Fabergé egg six days after suspect allegedly swallowed it

image.altText: Man (Vincent Tarzia) surrounded by members of the media

props.synopsis: SA Liberal leader Vincent Tarzia has stepped down. Pressure had been mounting in the lead-up to the 2026 state election, and predictions for the Liberal Party's chances are not looking promising.

title.children: Who will lead the SA Liberal Party to the next state election?

image.altText: Jai Opetaia stands with his arms outstretched

props.synopsis: Jai Opetaia may feel that fighting Hüseyin Cinkara is beneath him as he continues to hunt for a unification fight. But he cannot afford any lapses against a powerful puncher.

title.children: The quiet threat facing Opetaia in world title defence

image.altText: Cameron Smith looks to his right during his second round at the Australian Open.

props.synopsis: Cameron Smith did not beat around the bush when explaining how he plans to be among the contenders to claim the Australian Open at Royal Melbourne.

title.children: The simple approach Cam Smith is adopting as he chases Australian Open win

image.altText: White woman, black tshirt, sitting in a wheel chair, holding a orange spalding basketball in her hand, posing on a court.

props.synopsis: When Mellissa Dunn was starting her wheelchair basketball career in Darwin in the 1990s, she felt she had to do everything on her own. Three decades later, the silver-medallist Paralympian says the support now being offered to the next generation of para-athletes is "life-changing".

title.children: Paralympian returns to sport after 25 years to help next generation of athletes
